    Assignment interface for SADI

    • Method Detail

      • spin

        int spin(int wheelSize,
       int initialDelay,
       int finalDelay,
       int delayIncrement)
        spin the gaming wheel progressing from the initialDelay to the finalDelay in increments of delayIncrement delays are in milliseconds (ms) 1. begin by selecting a random starting number on the wheel (between 1 and wheelSize) 2. start at initialDelay then increment the delay each time a new number is passed on the wheel 3. call GameEngineCallback.nextNumber(...) each time a number is passed continue until delay >= finalDelay 4. call GameEngineCallback.result(...) to finish and process result
        Parameters:
        wheelSize - the size of the wheel from 1 .. wheelSize
        initialDelay - the starting delay in ms between numbers when the wheel starts
        finalDelay - the final delay in ms between numbers when the wheel stops (usually 0)
        delayIncrement - how much the wheel slows down after each number is passed
        Returns:
        the final result of the spin (the winning number)

        Parameters:

        boolean removePlayer(Player player)
        Parameters:

      • placeBet

        boolean placeBet(Player player,
               int number,
               int bet)
        Player places a bet for a number on the wheel
        Parameters:
        player -
        number - the lucky number the player picked
        bet - how many points to bet
        Returns:
        true if the bet is placed false if the player does not have enough points
        See Also:
        Player

      • calculateResult

        void calculateResult(int result)
        engine goes through all players and applies win or loss to points
        Parameters:
        result - the winning number from the wheel

      • getAllPlayers

      • addGameEngineCallback

        void addGameEngineCallback(GameEngineCallback gameEngineCallback)
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - a client specific implementation of GameEngineCallback used to perform display updates etc. you will use a different implementation of the GameEngineCallback for GUI and console versions

      • removeGameEngineCallback

        Parameters:
